Killing Floor 2 might be a more polished offering but as far as atmosphere is concerned Killing Floor 1 still rules.

so i played kf2 since almost 2017, but played this one since like two months ago, between those two i recommend this one. kf1 feels more dark, slow paced and kinda tactical to me. both of them have paid weapon dlcs but this one is well first of all cheaper, and has some interesting guns in it. but 90% of weapons that you actually use are from base game anyway. mapwise well this game as i said feels more dark and scary. kf2 felt more arcade to me.
moving from comparing those and focusing on kf1, the player base is low but still active and not toxic (and actually friendly in most cases) you can almost find 5 or 6 semi full servers anytime a day. the game doesn't feel very good solo because it wasn't designed for that. but even with only one other player, you can enjoy a lot! this is a truelly finished game, the guns are balanced, the perks are blanced the zeds are balanced the bugs are fixed and you dont need to worry about any of them. in higher difficulties the game can be frustrating since it relies heavily on your teamplay, but its a double edged sword, if your team plays well you enjoy the game alot but if they dont you might just leave, in lower diffs the team is really not a concern but keep in mind that you should know what is your role in the game, you should know the perks and the weapons because even in normal diff you can still get overwhelmed and die even as a lvl 6 character.
to sum it up i highly suggest that you pick the base game and community weapon pack one in a sale and enjoy the game!

I originally played Killing Floor 2 first and wanted to check out the original, which I highly recommend even though there isn't currently much of a player base. I personally enjoy playing solo, but you can still find lobbies if you choose to. This game (in my opinion) is a bit more challenging than KF2, but winning and leveling up your character classes feels more rewarding. Every character class here is usable and none are at a serious disadvantage compared to others. There's also a ton of great maps from years upon years of DLC, which are all free to play on.
